info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 2:14PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Elevated Fire Weather Conditions Sunday Afternoon and Evening across North Central Kansas... Breezy, warm, and dry conditions will lead to elevated fire weather conditions Sunday afternoon through late Sunday evening across portions of north-central Kansas. Of potential concern is a surge of very dry air arriving close to sunset Sunday, potentially lasting well into Sunday evening. Wind speeds and gusts will increase during this time, with a brief period of critical or near-critical fire weather conditions possible. Additionally, a cold front will move through later in the evening, with a westerly to northerly wind shift. While the risk of fire starts may be lower, any fire that does start will be more difficult to control due to falling humidity, increasing winds, and a wind shift. Stay tuned in case confidence in this potential increases. If so, a Red Flag Warning may be needed.
